birth_place.zh-cn: 日本山城国京都中山忠能邸

death_place.zh-cn: 东京府东京市明治宫殿

description.zh-cn: 日本第122代天皇，大日本帝国第一代大元帅。其在位期间，日本从一个孤立的封建国家转变为工业化的世界强国，史称明治维新。他名义上是甲午战争和日俄战争期间日军的最高指挥官。
description.en: The 122nd Emperor of Japan and the first Grand Marshal of the Empire of Japan. During his reign, Japan transformed from an isolated feudal state into an industrialized world power, a period known as the Meiji Restoration. He was the nominal supreme commander of the Japanese military during the First Sino-Japanese War and the Russo-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 日本第121代天皇，明治天皇的父亲。
description.en: The 121st Emperor of Japan, father of Emperor Meiji.

description.zh-cn: 孝明天皇的典侍，明治天皇的生母。
description.en: A lady-in-waiting (Tenshi) of Emperor Kōmei and the birth mother of Emperor Meiji.

description.zh-cn: 日本第123代天皇，明治天皇的儿子和继任者。
description.en: The 123rd Emperor of Japan, son and successor of Emperor Meiji.

description.zh-cn: 明治天皇的皇后。
description.en: The wife and empress consort of Emperor Meiji.

description.zh-cn: 明治天皇的典侍，大正天皇的生母。
description.en: A lady-in-waiting (Tenshi) of Emperor Meiji and the birth mother of Emperor Taishō.

description.zh-cn: 江户幕府第15代将军，将政权交还给明治天皇。
description.en: The 15th shogun of the Tokugawa shogunate, who returned political power to Emperor Meiji.

description.zh-cn: 日本历史上的最后一个武家政权，于1868年被明治新政府取代。
description.en: The last feudal military government of Japan, which was replaced by the Meiji government in 1868.

description.zh-cn: 《大日本帝国宪法》下授予天皇的最高军事头衔。
description.en: The highest military rank bestowed upon the Emperor under the Constitution of the Empire of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 日本君主的称号，国家的象征。
description.en: The title of the monarch of Japan, the symbol of the state.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治维新时期的内战，最终导致德川幕府的垮台和明治政府的确立。
description.en: A civil war in Japan during the Meiji Restoration, which led to the downfall of the Tokugawa shogunate and the establishment of the Meiji government.

description.zh-cn: 大清帝国与大日本帝国之间的一场战争，日本获胜后获得了台湾和澎湖群岛的主权。
description.en: A war between the Qing Empire and the Empire of Japan, in which Japan's victory led to its acquisition of sovereignty over Taiwan and the Penghu Islands.

description.zh-cn: 俄罗斯帝国与大日本帝国为争夺在中国东北和朝鲜半岛的利益而进行的战争。
description.en: A war fought between the Russian Empire and the Empire of Japan over rival imperial ambitions in Manchuria and Korea.

description.zh-cn: 日本的首都。明治天皇将皇室从京都迁至此地，并将其更名为东京。
description.en: The capital of Japan. Emperor Meiji moved the imperial court from Kyoto to this city and renamed it Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 日本的前首都，明治天皇的出生地。
description.en: The former capital of Japan and the birthplace of Emperor Meiji.

en: Constitution of the Empire of Japan

description.zh-cn: 大日本帝国的宪法，确立了天皇作为国家元首和军队最高指挥官的地位。
description.en: The constitution of the Empire of Japan, establishing the Emperor as the head of state and supreme commander of the military.

description.zh-cn: 甲午战争后，根据《马关条约》割让给大日本帝国，由明治天皇作为最高统治者。
description.en: Ceded to the Empire of Japan after the First Sino-Japanese War under the Treaty of Shimonoseki, with Emperor Meiji as the supreme ruler.

description.zh-cn: 甲午战争后，大清帝国与大日本帝国签订的条约，其中包括将台湾割让给日本。
description.en: A treaty signed between the Qing Empire and the Empire of Japan after the First Sino-Japanese War, which included the cession of Taiwan to Japan.

description.zh-cn: 在台湾日治时期对台湾行使主权的职位，由日本天皇担任。
description.en: The position exercising sovereignty over Taiwan during the period of Japanese rule, held by the Emperor of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 在朝鲜日治时期对朝鲜半岛行使主权的职位，由日本天皇担任。
description.en: The position exercising sovereignty over the Korean Peninsula during the period of Japanese rule, held by the Emperor of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 大日本帝国与大韩帝国签订的条约，正式将朝鲜半岛并入日本版图。
description.en: A treaty signed between the Empire of Japan and the Korean Empire, officially annexing the Korean Peninsula into Japanese territory.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜王朝末期的国号，于1910年因《日韩合并条约》而灭亡。
description.en: The name of the state of the late Joseon dynasty, which was extinguished in 1910 by the Japan-Korea Annexation Treaty.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜半岛被大日本帝国统治的时期。
description.en: The period when the Korean Peninsula was under the rule of the Empire of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 明治时期的皇族和政治家，曾任总裁、左大臣等职。
description.en: An imperial prince and politician of the Meiji period, who served in positions such as President and Minister of the Left.

description.zh-cn: 明治维新的重要政治家，曾任辅相等职。
description.en: A key statesman of the Meiji Restoration, who served in positions such as Junior Chancellor.

description.zh-cn: 明治时期的政治家，曾任辅相、右大臣、太政大臣等职。
description.en: A politician of the Meiji period, who served in positions such as Junior Chancellor, Minister of the Right, and Chancellor of the Realm.

description.zh-cn: 日本首任内阁总理大臣，明治维新元老之一。
description.en: The first Prime Minister of Japan and one of the genrō of the Meiji Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜独立运动家，于1909年刺杀了伊藤博文。
description.en: A Korean independence activist who assassinated Itō Hirobumi in 1909.

description.zh-cn: 明治天皇是孝明天皇的第二皇子。
description.en: Emperor Meiji was the second son of Emperor Kōmei.

description.zh-cn: 明治天皇的生母是中山庆子。
description.en: Emperor Meiji's birth mother was Nakayama Yoshiko.

description.zh-cn: 昭宪皇太后是明治天皇的皇后。
description.en: Empress Shōken was the empress consort of Emperor Meiji.

description.zh-cn: 大正天皇是明治天皇的儿子。
description.en: Emperor Taishō was the son of Emperor Meiji.

description.zh-cn: 大正天皇的生母是柳原爱子。
description.en: Emperor Taishō's birth mother was Yanagiwara Naruko.

description.zh-cn: 明治天皇是日本第122代天皇。
description.en: Emperor Meiji was the 122nd Emperor of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 根据《大日本帝国宪法》，明治天皇是名义上的陆海军大元帅。
description.en: According to the Constitution of the Empire of Japan, Emperor Meiji was the nominal Grand Marshal of the Army and Navy.

description.zh-cn: 明治天皇出生于京都其外祖父中山忠能的宅邸。
description.en: Emperor Meiji was born in Kyoto at the residence of his maternal grandfather, Nakayama Tadayasu.

description.zh-cn: 德川庆喜将政权交还给天皇，结束了持续265年的江户幕府时代。
description.en: Tokugawa Yoshinobu returned political power to the Emperor, ending the 265-year-long Edo Shogunate.

description.zh-cn: 戊辰战争的结果是江户幕府被推翻，明治新政府得以建立。
description.en: The Boshin War resulted in the overthrow of the Edo Shogunate and the establishment of the new Meiji government.

description.zh-cn: 明治天皇是戊辰战争期间帝国军队名义上的领袖。
description.en: Emperor Meiji was the nominal leader of the Imperial forces during the Boshin War.

description.zh-cn: 明治天皇将皇室与中央政府自京都迁移至江户，并将江户更名为东京，使其成为新的首都。
description.en: Emperor Meiji moved the Imperial Household and the central government from Kyoto to Edo, renaming it Tokyo and making it the new capital.

description.zh-cn: 1889年，明治天皇颁布了《大日本帝国宪法》。
description.en: In 1889, Emperor Meiji promulgated the Constitution of the Empire of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 作为日军名义上的最高指挥官，明治天皇推动了甲午战争。
description.en: As the nominal supreme commander of the Japanese military, Emperor Meiji pushed for the First Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 甲午战争以日本胜利告终，随后签订了《马关条约》。
description.en: The First Sino-Japanese War ended with Japan's victory, leading to the signing of the Treaty of Shimonoseki.

description.zh-cn: 根据《马关条约》，台湾的主权被割让给大日本帝国。
description.en: According to the Treaty of Shimonoseki, the sovereignty of Taiwan was ceded to the Empire of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 甲午战争后，明治天皇成为台湾的最高统治者。
description.en: After the First Sino-Japanese War, Emperor Meiji became the supreme ruler of Taiwan.

description.zh-cn: 明治天皇在日俄战争期间于大本营督战。
description.en: Emperor Meiji oversaw the war effort from the Imperial General Headquarters during the Russo-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 安重根刺杀了伊藤博文，该事件加速了日本对韩国的吞并。
description.en: An Jung-geun assassinated Itō Hirobumi, an event that accelerated Japan's annexation of Korea.

description.zh-cn: 《日韩合并条约》的签订宣告了大韩帝国的灭亡。
description.en: The signing of the Japan-Korea Treaty of 1910 marked the end of the Korean Empire.

description.zh-cn: 《日韩合并条约》的签订标志着朝鲜日治时期的开始。
description.en: The signing of the Japan-Korea Treaty of 1910 marked the beginning of the period of Korea under Japanese rule.

description.zh-cn: 《日韩合并条约》签订后，明治天皇成为韩国的最高统治者。
description.en: After the signing of the Japan-Korea Treaty of 1910, Emperor Meiji became the supreme ruler of Korea.

description.zh-cn: 有栖川宫炽仁亲王在明治政府中担任总裁、左大臣等高级职务。
description.en: Prince Arisugawa Taruhito held senior positions in the Meiji government, such as President and Minister of the Left.

description.zh-cn: 岩仓具视在明治政府中担任辅相等高级职务。
description.en: Iwakura Tomomi held senior positions in the Meiji government, such as Junior Chancellor.

position.en: Junior Chancellor, Minister of the Right, Chancellor of the Realm

description.zh-cn: 三条实美在明治政府中担任辅相、右大臣、太政大臣等高级职务。
description.en: Sanjō Sanetomi held senior positions in the Meiji government, such as Junior Chancellor, Minister of the Right, and Chancellor of the Realm.
